dict.acceptation: 穿过；横穿，横过；与…交叉；在…对面；
横过，越过；在对面；交叉；斜对面；

sent.orig: I climbed across mountaintops, swam all across the ocean blue.
sent.trans: 我跨越过山顶，游过蓝色的海洋。

sent.orig: We came across open water which we had to swim across.
sent.trans: 我们还遇到过无冰的水面，我们不得不游着前进。

sent.orig: We travelled across country, ie across fields, etc or not by a main road.
Dust blows across the Mediterranean from North Africa and across Sicily to western Greece.
sent.trans: 沙暴从北非地中海沿岸刮起、经西西里岛直奔希腊东岸。

sent.orig: They went across the dark shadow of the woods on the hill, and across its peak.
sent.trans: 他们穿过山上那片森森的树影，越过山头。
